page.title: 01Gazeteer of Area 04680297
page.content: Secluded by-ways lead to the mainly brick built villages of Illston-on- the-Hill and Carlton Curlieu,which lie in undulating open countryside comprising some of the richest grazing land in England. The lanes and fields are boarded by mixed hedgerows of hawthorne, black- thorne, elder, sycamore and ash and form the habitat for a variety of wildlife. An abundance of majestic trees such as oak, beech, horsechestnut, although sadly the elm is no longer to be found, give an impression of parkland. The Gartree Road, which is an old Roman Road, diagonally bisects the area. The population is unlikely to increase in future years as the villages are "closed" to further housing developments.
